title: For Sale:  1955 Springfield M1 Garand (Correct)
postcontent:
Looking to possibly trade or sell my Sprigfield M1 Garand. The Garand receiver is dated to May of 1955 along with the barrel. All parts are correct for this rifle, I cross referenced build sheets, manuals, and several collector websites that are knowledgable in the M1 Garand. I collect and restore M1 Garands for a hobby, so I know what they are, what makes them correct, and what they are worth. 

The Garand you are looking at is the one at the bottom of the three. The rifle has the correct 1.5" DAS and circled P on the stock. Everything down to the gas plug and springs are right on this beauty. The only thing questionable is the top forward most handguard, but to fix that will cost you some time on eBay and about $40. I wasn't too particular about that since there are no markings of any kind on hanguards to identify them as SA. 

This M1 Garand is also unique in the fact that it is a 5.7 million serial number block. The 5.7m range isn't a common find and only about 6,000 were ever produced due to HRA making a stink about SA using their serial block. My value on the rifle is $1700 OBO. If you know anything about M1 Garands, you'll know that I'm on the lower end in price, especially if you're a CMP forum member.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Remington Model 700 30-06
postcontent:
I love this gun and don't want to sell it. I'd prefer a trade for another hunting rifle that has a pistol grip. This gun is the Remington Model 700 which sends off 30-06 rounds. It was cerakoted in this tan color. The action is really smooth and I have no problems hitting gatorade bottles at 300 yards. This boom stick is spot on. It has a Simmons 3x9 scope and I put a cheek raise on it which is easily removed. It holds 4+1 has an amazingly light trigger which makes release extremely smooth.

If we trade for another 30-06 rifle then I will keep my ammo but if you pay cash I will give you what is left of my ammo.

The rifle hasn't seen a lot of fire and has minimal signs of wear and tear.

I'm asking a fair price of $600 OBO or trade for something of equal value. I would like another Remington 700 with a pistol grip but will consider other options. It would cost more to replace the stock than to just get a new gun so that is why I am posting.

title: For Sale:  PREMIUM 30-06 SUPERCHARGED Ammo - 150 gr. SPTZ @ 3000 fps - 20 Round Box
postcontent:
http://extreme-impact-ammo.com/index.php?l=product_detail&p=263

This Super Charged 30-06 load was designed to be the premier deer load for 30-06, providing devastating, one shot terminal destruction of deer “clockwork”. The 150gr. Spitzer is traveling at around 3,000 fps from typical 30-06 rifles and the bullet will mushroom violently at these impact velocities. It may even fragment, depending on bullet placement and impact speed. For big game up to 350 lbs, tremendous penetration is not needed, so this bullet mushrooms radically and might even break up. (Much like our Deer Grenade 44 Mag. Item # 4F) When high speed bullets act this way terminally, the effect is devastating and they absolutely “dump” deer sized game animals in their tracks. This bullet does not give ample penetration for super big game like Yukon moose and we have designed other 30-06 loads for that type of task, but this load will collapse deer sized game unlike any other 30-06 load. This load is designed for any game weighing less than 350 lbs, such as medium sized black bear, hogs, antelope, deer, etc.

Note our below real world velocities, shot from real world rifles. We do not use extra long laboratory test barrels that give false high velocity readings.

3050 fps - Kimber 8400 Montana, 24 inch barrel
2970 fps - Winchester All Terrain (circa 1995), 22 inch barrel
2957 fps - Winchester Feather weight (circa 1950) 22 inch barrel
This ammunition is designed for use in ALL 30-06 chambered rifles that are in normal operating condition.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Timney AR-10 Competition Trigger
postcontent:
For sale/trade is my Timney AR-10 Competition Trigger.  It is a fantastic trigger, and a must have upgrade for anyone looking to eek extra accuracy out of their AR-10 rifle.  The trigger is a drop-in unit, making install quick and easy.  The trigger is a single-stage trigger with a trigger weight of 4 lbs.  I have maybe fired 200-300 rounds with this trigger installed, just getting broken in.

The reason I am looking to sell/trade is because I have decided that I much prefer a two stage trigger for the type of shooting that I will be doing with my AR-10.  My preference is to trade, so I will only sell if the offer is right.  This model retails for $259.99.  I am looking to trade for a Geissele two-stage trigger, preferably the Geissele SSA-E, Hi-Speed NM, or 3-Gun triggers, but any AR two-stage trigger will be considered.  Willing to move cash one way or another to even the deal out if neccesary.

postcontent:
I have a Benchmade Infidel 3300, double-edge plain blade OTF knife for sale. Normally only available to law enforcement and active military, I acquired this directly from Benchmade through a US Army Special Forces friend. Knife is like new - only clicked open and closed a few times because, well, you just can't not do this! But clean, in great condition (see photos)…never carried or used.

The Infidel is a marvel of engineering - lightening fast, strong, beautifully made…a great example of Benchmade's manufacturing and McHenry design. Perfect for a collector, or anyone wanting reliable one-handed operation with a "wow" factor.  Knife sells new (if you can even buy one) for $470, asking $350 firm. Includes original box & cordura nylon sheath. http://www.benchmade.com/products/3300 

I checked with local law enforcement, and was told this is legal to own and sell in private sale in OH. Many other states have similar laws, but we'll have to check on your end. I will not sell/ship to CA, NY or MA because I know there are restrictions there. Concealed carry is a whole different set of laws that I would strongly recommend understanding in your state.

I operate NOCO Hydrographics here in Fort Collins. If you're looking to get a firearm hydrodipped, I offer both the best prices as well as the best quality materials. I know how important quality is when it comes to any firearm work, and that's why I strive to be the best in the business. When you bring me one of your firearms, you can rest assured that the job will be done right, and come out looking great. After the pattern is applied, the part is coated with a high-strength clear coat with an internal flex agent. Camouflage

title: For Sale/Trade:  Norinco NHM 91
postcontent: What I have here is a Norinco NHM 91 RPK style rifle. This AK variant differs from standard AKs due to its longer heavier barrel (20"), it's lighter trigger pull, and it's thicker receiver (1.5 mm versus 1mm).  This rifle is less common than the Norinco Mak90 due to the fact that there were significantly less of them imported. Since the ban in 94' it has become even more rare. What's here on our soil stays here. That's all. The rifle comes with original box, manual, bipod, cleaning rod, tool, and a couple 30 rd magazines (2-3). This Norinco has the integrated thumb hole wood stock and furniture. Gun is a real tack driver - much more accurate than my Zastava M70 PAP. My asking price is $1000 firm. Must be TN resident and prefer HCP. I am open to trades of equal value. Don't be scared just ask worst case I say no thanks. Also can add ammo if desired. The Integra is a complete stock LS, but don't let that scare you away its had a complete upper rebuild less than 2k miles ago. New radiator, brand new head, new water pump, new seals, for everything of course, new thermostat, all new belts ETC. Basically they guy I bought it off of got me good. There is NO HONDA CANCER at all still has ac PS heat cruise control, only thing is there's a rust spot in the hood which I was going to put a cf hood on if I kept it and there's no radio or exhaust from the headers back. They took those things along with the battery center caps to the rims and air intake when it was stolen, just got it back a few days ago, put a brand new battery in it this morning make sure everything worked ok starting fine(idles high but that's because there is no exhaust and no o2 sensor) put stock air intake back in with a brand new air filter. All it needs is some TLC with the paint because the guy who owned it before me didn't know what he was doing and he let the paint run in a few areas, and it has a 2 scratches from when it was stolen. Its possible the runs could even be wet sanded off and just clear coated again. I bought the car almost 3 years ago from a guy in Athens and it test drive fine, then I got on the highway and that's when it over heated and I ended up replacing the entire top half of the motor. Its all new except the block. I paid $3500 for it, after i fixed it it got stolen and I just got it back a few days ago. Paid $150 to get it out of the impound lot, $75 for the battery(connections lol) the top end rebuild coast me about $500 because I did all the work myself along with my buddy who is a Wyotech mechanic graduate. So I have about $4200 already. O and the teggy had black housed halo projector headlights as well and needs the driver window and rear window re-tinted. And is has GSR cloth interior. Shooting straight no BS here. Only rust spot on this car is a weld in the driver door that didn't get a chance to seal before it was taken but it can be grind-ed out and re welded and sealed. The Smith and Wesson Model 39 was a semi-automatic pistol developed for the US Army service pistol trials of 1954.[1] After the Army abandoned its search for a new pistol, the Model 39 went on the civilian market in 1955 and was the first of Smith & Wesson's first generation semi-automatic pistols. Used by the Illinois State Police and the US Navy SEALs, it was a groundbreaking pistol for use with the military and law-enforcement agencies.

title: For Sale:  Iver Johnson Champion, 16ga, top snap, full choke shotgun
postcontent:
This is an Iver Johnson Champion, 16ga, top snap, full choke shotgun.  The barrel is in generally good condition but it needs cleaning and has some light pitting.   CHAMPION MODEL 36-------------------------------------------1909-1922
 Single barrel; rebounding center mounted hammer; top lever operated break open design; gauges: 12, 16, and 20; barrel length: 28, 30, and 32 inches (features barrel and lug forged in one piece) bored full chock only; American black Walnut butt stock and fore-end; automatic extractors; weight 6¾ pounds; overall length with 30 inch barrel 45 inches; case hardened receiver (nickel available as option), browned barrel; automatic ejectors extra cost option; .410 bore, 24 and 28 gauges offered in 1913; 24 gauge dropped 1928; all gauges except 12 dropped after 1941; name changed to Champion single Barrel in 1917.
 CHAMPION SINGLE BARREL--------------------------------------1923-1978
 This is the same gun as the earlier Model 36 champion except that the smaller gauges are now built on the same frame as the large gagues. See above picture for specifications. The exact year production stopped has not yet been determined. Some of these single barrel shotguns have been seen with Canadian marking, these were most likely shipped to Canada and then marked as there is no evidence that Iver Johnson’s Arms & Cycle Works ever had a manufacturing factory in Canada.

We have additional higher resolution pictures of this item available upon request.

The M1 carbine (formally the United States Carbine, Caliber .30, M1) is a lightweight, easy-to-use semi-automatic carbine that became a standard firearm for the U.S. military during World War II, the Korean War and the Vietnam War, and was produced in several variants. It was widely used by U.S. and foreign military, paramilitary and police forces, and has also been a popular civilian firearm.

Hard to find manufacturer - Standard Products Approximately 247,160 total Carbines were made by Standard Products: About 4.0% of M1 Carbines made. Receiver marked "STD. PRO." title: For Sale:  Old Cresent 16 gauge sidelock double
postcontent:
Here I've got a beaut of an old 16 gauge side lock double barrel shotgun. It is not currently in full shooting condition but could be made so or would be an most excellent showpiece or decorative wall hanger. Cheap!
This gun was made by the Cresent firearms company of Norwich, Connecticut. USA. It is the New Empire model. 28 in barrels and 161/2 inches from breech face to butt end. It is nitro proofed with forged steel and not Damascus or twist so fine for modern loads. Like most of these old guns it has sear problems(worn) which might be remedied by parts from Numrich. It also has the common wrist break on the stock. It is all there, though, and in very nice condition. The parts alone are worth more than the asking price so if you are wanting a nice project or a beautiful display, here you go.$100 OBO, out here near Lincoln, face to face. postcontent:
Description from Magpul:

"The Magpul PRS (Precision Rifle/Sniper) – AR15/M16 Model is a drop-in, precision-adjustable butt stock for rifles with A1/A2 fixed stocks. Designed to offer the fine-tuned, customized feel of a precision target stock, the PRS is adjustable for both comb height and length-of-pull without sacrificing the durability necessary to withstand the operational environment. Compared to the A2 stock, the PRS can shorten LOP by .25" or extend it by .75" as well as provide three-quarters of an inch of comb height adjustment. Machined aluminum adjustment knobs feature positive-locking click detents to maintain position under recoil and allows easy, tool-less adjustments by simply rotating the knobs. Aluminum butt-plate and alloy steel adjustment shafts provide stability and strength to withstand severe impact conditions. Rubber butt-pad offers positive shoulder purchase to prevent slippage for optimal accuracy even with body armor or modular gear. Bottom Picatinny-type rail allows for monopod use, additional sling mounts or storage. Stock includes all mounting hardware for A1/A2 type rifles with fixed stock. 

Made in U.S.A."

This stock was used on my bench rifle and is in near perfect condition. I have the original box and will ship it (for an additional fee) but would prefer a local pickup. 

I am willing to trade but only for a Magpul UBR.
